external_links.text: Table of Reference Amounts for Food
external_links.context: The serving size is based on the edible portion of the food as sold and is the amount of food that an adult would reasonably eat at a single eating occasion. The Table of Reference Amounts for Food provides instructions on how to determine and declare the serving size for a variety of categories of food, including the category "Eggs and egg substitutes".

external_links.text: Foods exempt from the front-of-package (FOP) nutrition symbol requirements
external_links.context: See Foods exempt from the front-of-package (FOP) nutrition symbol requirements for details on the exemptions.

external_links.text: C. Fat, Fatty Acids, and Cholesterol Related Statements and Claims
external_links.context: The nutritional characteristics of eggs do not meet the conditions set out for cholesterol claims in section C. Fat, Fatty Acids, and Cholesterol Related Statements and Claims of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims. Refer to Nutrient content claims for more information.
